newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah steady in slow late trading.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah steady in slow late trading.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah was steady against the dollar in slow late trading on Friday.
One Japanese bank dealer said rupiah liquidity remained steady in the afternoon, with overnight money hovering at nine percent despite weekly tax payments.

Dealers said initial concerns of possible tightening did not materialise, causing the rupiah to soften slighly. Spot rupiah was at 2,428.4/28.7 at 0915 GMT, compared with an opening of 2,426.75/27.75.
One U.S. bank dealer said there was some short-covering in dollars due to the weekend factor.
Tomorrow and today rupiah closed at 2,428.1/28.4 and 2,426.0/26.5, respectively.
Overnight swap was at 1.0/1.1 and tom/next at 0.26/0.30.
Dealers said longer-term swaps were stable after easing in the morning on ample rupiah supply.
Another U.S. bank dealer said offshore operators continued to hold long rupiah in the forward market, but reduced some positions when they took profit in the relatively ample market.
"But I think they still tend to remain long in forwards," the dealer said, adding the market was still vulnerable to spillover from rumours of swap restrictions in other centres.
One-month swaps were at 12.20/12.50, two at 25.50/26.25, three at 38.5/39.5 and six at 79.0/80.0 points.
The central bank kept its intervention band at 2,421/2,613 and its conversion band at 2,421/2,469 on Friday.
Dealers said, however, there was no spillover on Friday after the Jakarta swap market was jolted briefly late on Thursday following rumours of swap restrictions in Malaysia.

There were rumours in Malaysia that Bank Negara would adopt the same sort of foreign exchange controls as in Thailand. The talk started when the central bank called for a meeting on Friday with chief executive officers of some banks.
Banking sources, however, said Bank Negara was meeting the bankers to discuss routine foreign exchange activities.
